rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language without high-potency verbs, potent metaphors, superlatives, or critical alert phrases.
The segment discusses future production ('will produce') and production metrics ('represents an annual output increase'), which are excluded by Q3 rules.
Segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports production increase percentages but contains no explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes production projections and increase, not capabilities or preparedness.
Reports production projections ('up to 14.9 million tons', 'up to 15.35 million tons') and percentage increase ('up to 2.6%', 'up to 3.7%') using standard verbs.
